thread.title: Angels reportedly pick Yankees' Eppler as GM
thread.title_full: Angels reportedly pick Yankees' Eppler as GM

title: Angels reportedly pick Yankees' Eppler as GM
text:
Angels reportedly pick Yankees' Eppler as GM Los Angeles parted ways with Dipoto in July UPDATED 10:32 AM CDT Oct 05, 2015 A Large Text Photos 
New York Yankees assistant general manager Billy Eppler is expected to be named general manager of the Los Angeles Angels. Rams beat Cards with defense 
An announcement could be made as early as Monday, according to multiple reports. 
The Angels parted with Jerry Dipoto, who officially resigned in July, because of a rift with the on-field coaching staff. 
The Angels considered their own personnel department, including former Dipoto assistants Matt Klentak and Scott Servais and director of pro scouting Hal Morris, before considering options from other teams. They included Eppler, Dodgers vice president Josh Byrnes and Blue Jays assistant general manager Tony LaCava. 
Dipoto was hired earlier this week to become general manager of the Seattle Mariners. 
Eppler has been with the Yankees since 2005, overseeing the reconfiguration of their scouting department. He was directly involved with scouting Masahiro Tanaka, including an extended stint following Tanaka's outings in person in Japan.
